Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: JessBubbles
Reviews.Content: I've been to Istanbul many times but never had such a wonderful yet unique experience as staying at the Ajia Hotel. Arriving by complimentary vintage launch to their jetty at the front of the hotel was an amazing start. The staff bend over backwards to accommodate your every need. The food is great, the location amazing and travelling to the main tourist centre by water taxi rather than weathering the inevitable traffic jams was amazing. The rooms are palatial by European standards. The only thing I could fault was a power outage in the wee hours which was soon fixed with much apology. We travelled with a group of 8 friends and had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, sumptuous idyllic Bosphorous retreat”
Reviews.Author: weekend_for_two
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Ajia as the second part of our honeymoon in Istanbul. The first half was spent in the old city, the second half the short distance up the river in Ajia. Yes, it does look as stunning in person as it does on their photographs. Yes, you do catch your own speedboat taxi to the hotel from the European side; yes, the rooms and views are just gorgeous, and yes - the restaurant and bar really are as good as they say. Well worth pushing the boat out for a room overlooking the river - and taking the boat taxi (gratis) over from the Asian to the other side, particularly to the pretty villages (Ermigan and Ortakoy two shining stars) was a joy. Fab food, breakfast on the terrace (go for the Turkish breakfast for a real treat!) watching the boats cruise by was great, so relaxing. Staff were professional and helpful, advising which local sights to see and organised a private boat tour for the two of us. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Brunch”
Reviews.Author: coco55555
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for Brunch and was not disappointed. Great quality food and a beautiful setting overlooking the sea. Would definitely recommend it, absolutely lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, just very far away”
Reviews.Author: dutchguy2
Reviews.Content: A group of us, making use of a special offer, spent a couple of nights in the A'jia hotel and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The hotel itself looks very nice, and I can only imagine how fantastic it must be in the summer (it has a beautiful terrace on the Bosphorus). The rooms were nice, not out of this world, but not bad either. The bathroom was functional (although there was not enough water pressure in the shower). The daily treats were nice. The breakfast was good, if somewhat strange (but that could also be my unfamiliarity with the Turkish breakfast culture). The one major, major downside is how far away it is from the tourist hotspots (Aya Sophia, Grand Bazar, etc). We used both taxis and water taxis and it is safe to say that the only way to go is with the water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: richardbloo
Reviews.Content: A fantastic location on the bosphorous with views over the city. Yes it takes a bit of time to get downtown but crossing the bosphorous in the hotels motor boat is part of the magic. and the rooms overlooking the sea are amazing - and having breakfast, lunch dinner or cocktails within a few feet of the water is magical. Greta location, great food and great service. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery, but strange service”
Reviews.Author: Katie N
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed two days and nights at the Ajia in late November and found it overpriced and awkward. It's overtly modern with a museum like lobby area made completely of polished granite and open to the ceiling, yet the staff was unfamiliar with the most basic elements of table service in their quite expensive restaurant. Even though we were the only diners, our glasses were always empty unless we called the waiter over to ask for another drink - including water! Also, the prices in the restaurant (such as the equivalent of $150 a bottle for Robert Mondavi Woodbridge Cabernet) were outrageous. After the first night in the hotel, one realizes why other hotels don't go with the "museum marble/ open foyer" look in their lobby. It was incredibly loud. Apparently, some of the staff had children present (?), but my friend and I were joking that it sounded like a daycare center because of the echoes of what were probably only 2 or 3 kids. Finally, the website pictures make it seem like its in a quiet green area. It's actually on a fairly busy street in a small local village that is not tourist friendly. One must take a boat across the Bosphorous in order to venture into a "cute" town with anything to do.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the Bosphorous”
Reviews.Author: PetiteLinds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights, three of which were booked through a Luxury Link package. We knew from a friend's experience that the hotel was quite a trek from the sights in Istanbul, but were looking forward to spending time on the Asian side of the city away from the hustle and bustle of tourist hot spots. While getting to and from Old Town and the New District did take time, it was worth being able to experience another part of the city and get a bit of local flavor. Contrary to wait previous reviewers wrote, there are some small towns within walking distance of the hotel that offer great eats and a chance to see what normal Istanbul life is like. (You must try the yogurt in Kanlica!) As part of the package we booked, we had a waterfront room overlooking the Bosphorous. The room was very spacious with an especially comfortable bed, a fantastic bathroom (huge bathtub and waterfall shower), and a balcony perfect for reading or just watch the boats float by. The hotel accommodations are definitely top notch, but you don't necessarily feel like a special guest. The hotel staff is not very responsive to emails (we sent two that went unanswered) and only helpful to a point. I imagine the hotel staff can offer excellent recommendations to guests who can spend a lot of money and who aren't interested in getting a real deal Istanbul experience. For example, instead of telling us about local shops to visit in city's young artsy neighborhoods the hotel suggested we go to the high end shopping mall around the corner. Coming from Paris and the US, the last thing we wanted to do was go shopping in a mall and be bombarded with brand names. We just felt a bit out of touch with their typical clientele and were disappointed that they couldn't switch gears to offer us solid suggestions for a young couple out to explore the city. Overall we enjoyed the hotel for what it was, but wouldn't necessarily make a point of going back. + super comfortable beds with scented sheets + comfy bathrobes and slippers + giant bathroom and great bath products + magnificent views of Istanbul - far from tourist attractions - semi helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Beware the location if it's your first visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: luxury-lizard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here based on the web site and the hotel's reviews on this forum. In spite of many comments in the reviews about the location we did not pay sufficient heed to these. From the hotel it's a one-hour trip by taxi and public ferry then a 20 minute walk to the major attractions of the Old Town. The cost of this is about $13 (USD) so the cost is not really the issue - it's the time and inconvenience. You can take a taxi all the way - but would be much more expensive and take longer due to the traffic. Once back at the hotel after a day of site-seeing you are sort of stranded - there is nothing within walking distance that we could find. Being a small boutique hotel, it has nothing to offer in the way of facilities; e.g. pool, spa, bar, etc. The restaurant is closed most evenings (so it seems) for private functions (it was closed 2 of the 3 nights we were there, Monday-Thursday) - so you need to take a taxi to a restaurant. You can eat in your room or on a small side terrace right beside the hotel entrance but this is literally only a few steps from the road and as such is very noisy. After checking out the 2 restaurants the hotel recommended on TA we elected not to go to either. So on evening we ate on the terrace and the other we took the hotel speed boat to the European side then walked to Bebek, a trendy waterfront suburb some 50 minutes walk away - this was OK but far from ideal. Overall, the hotel is fine - we were not quite as impressed as some of the other reviewers - the decor seemed a bit tired. For a hotel to be rated 5*, IMO, it should have soft pillows and high quality linen - it did not quite meet this particular standard. The front desk staff (the only one who speak English) were friendly and helpful but not overly so.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as the photos - beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Bl0ndie82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ajia on the first week of August as a part holiday/business trip to decide whether this place was the perfect venue for our wedding. We had a fantastic time, so much so that we have now booked our wedding here for next year, however there were a few minor issues... Firstly we had asked for a taxi/boat transfer from the airport, however we never got to go on the boat as our taxi driver drove all the way to the hotel, this may have been due to a delayed flight (by 1 hour) however this was not adequately conveyed to us. The minibus was lovely with free maps and water for the journey and we got to experience the notorious Istanbul traffic at rush hour!!! We had been promised a welcome cocktail, again something which never materialised, but to be honest we never actually asked about this and it was only when I returned home did I remember! The final issue was that on our first night there was an event on which meant that both the inside and outside restaurants were closed, so we had the choice to either eat in our room or at the side of the hotel facing the entrance. I was not impressed by this at all, as we had specifically wanted to experience the hotels waterside dining. However I must say that the silver service received in the room was lovely and the staff went to a great effort... Now onto the pros - The bedrooms were fantastic - we stayed in the deluxe mezzanine suite and it was superb. Free fruit, water and lovely beds and the view was fantastic!! Every day the room was refreshed with different fruit, a weather forecast (nice touch) and your personalised business card to give to taxis with your address which was fab as most taxis didn;t know what we were saying!!! The food was fantastic and excellently displayed and the wine was lovely, when we eventually got to dine in the restaurant the next day it was magical, with low lighting and the most fantastic mushroom risotto & souffle! Special thanks go to Mete who showed us some of the other rooms available - all were fabulous and to the events manager Firez who was lovely and very helpful. I would recommend paying extra to get one of the top floor suites with a balcony. Be aware that it is a 20/30min drive to get to the heart of town and it does feel quite isolated which only adds to the romantic atnosphere. Do check though whether an event is on as you may be slightly dissapointed if so.... Fantastic hotel, excellent service and a sublime breakfast and I cannot wait for our wedding next year now!

Reviews.Title: “10/10 - A'jia is Istanbul at its romantic best”
Reviews.Author: JohnnieD1909
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. A boat (1950s St Tropez style) takes you from the European side to the Asian and A'jia. You are welcomed as you step off into what can only be described as a boutique hotel at its very best. The manager Mete Uskudarli has his team to meet, greet and all with a smile (something I'd not experienced too much in other parts of Istanbul). Then they take you to the room.. THE ROOM!! Front facing on to the Bhosphorus and sensational in every detail. I'd ordered roses for my girlfriend and they had been carefully positioned on the bed in a perfect presentation. The bed itself is the most comfortable we'd slept in, so good we asked the manager for details so we can order our own. 10/10. We only spent the one night at A'jia but lunch was a perfectly pink salmon, cooked to perfection and then dinner was a spectacular Turkish buffet, a fantastic menu and every dish full of flavour. We had the perfect night and the staff couldn't have been more attentive. Exceptional. I highly recommend A'jia for a romantic getaway. There is no swimming pool, gym etc.. for that, go to the Four Seasons or Conrad. This is a one-off romantic getaway so surprise your better half and enjoy every second. A'jia gets an A in my book. Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms but not a 5-star experience overall”
Reviews.Author: KaraDE533
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in at the A'jia Hotel for 3 nights in August. The hotel itself is exactly as pictured on the website - beautiful, modern decor, a Tempur-Pedic bed, huge bathroom with separate tub (big enough for 2) and shower. Our room was waterfront on the first floor and it was lovely to wake each morning with the sun shining on the water. Guests do need to realize this hotel is very far from the main sites. We were dismayed to see how often the taxi drivers attempted to swindle us with extra charges and inflated fares (over the meter reading). The average fare was approx 25 Euros each way with no traffic. Ataturk airport is approximately 30-40 Euros with no traffic. The boat shuttle to the European side is a quick fun trip in itself and will save you about 5 Euros on the taxi into the sites. There were a couple of small things each day that diminished our enjoyment with the stay. An event was booked at the hotel for one night of our stay so guests were only allowed to dine in the restaurant or the lobby - this is not something we were notified of in advance. When you pay to be able to have a romantic stay on the water, it was disappointing to be barred from the loveliest area of the hotel. Lounge chairs as pictured on the website were not available when we first arrived; my husband inquired with two staff about them and not given a clear answer (this may have been lost in translation), but they were out the following day. The hotel was very noisy in the morning - (beginning around 7); my husband did complain about this on the second morning and was given the explanation that a staff meeting was going on. Lastly, the service and food at the restaurant did not match the accommodations of the hotel. Again, small details, but fine hotels thrive on attending to such matters - for example, empty plates left for 15 minutes without being cleared, water glasses not being refilled (with the sparkling water placed in a chiller away just out of reach from the table), dessert or coffee not being offered at the end of a meal or even a waiter asking if you would like anything else after the entree was served. My husband had to send his steak back the first day, and then only ate half of the second steak; this was noted and removed from our bill appropriately. There are reportedly several good restaurants in the area, so one suggestion might be to eat at one of those and return for drinks on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Superb place”
Reviews.Author: Blackpearl99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the Bosphorus, dinner is served at the water, best: during the sunset (the sun goes down on the other side of the Bosphorus, the light is reflected in the water). To sum up the view is awesome. So is the hotel, a real boutique hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful. Wife is free and fast. The food is excellent (dinner and breakfast), various good restaurants can be reached within 15 minutes (taxi/foot). The room was clean and big and directed to the Bosphorus. There is a downside: the hotel is not located close to the city center, but it's worth to stay there as a couple to enjoy romantic nights.

Reviews.Title: “What a gorgeous location. Good for the soul.”
Reviews.Author: ParisFifi
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful boutique hotel. Stayed there for two nights in June. The hotel itself is a former Ottoman mansion, right on the banks of the Bosphorus river in Istanbul. Lovely room, lovely bathroom products. Very large bed. Had the pleasure of one of the rooms on the very top floor, which had a delightful balcony and a spectacular view of the river. Breakfast very good - one of the options was a sort of healthy start breakfast which was great, and I was able to dine with the river lapping at my feet. Only catch is that the rooms are quite warm - air conditioning seems a little challenged. Also, didn't fancy leaving the balcony doors open all night for fear of who might be staying in room next door, as it would be easy to hop over the dividing walls. But would definitely recommend, and definitely revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views across Bosphorus; outstanding rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: SeafarerRI
Reviews.Content: The A'jia Hotel is a very unique place. It is a nineteenth century large Ottoman style home, built directly on the waterfront, on the Asian side of Istanbul. The exterior of the hotel retains its nineteenth century appearance. But the inside has been gutted and completely rebuilt as a thoroughly contemporary 'minimalist design' luxury hotel. The room we stayed in on the third floor, in celebration of our wedding anniversary, was enormous; polished wood floors, window wall looking out on a spacious balcony that in turn, had a commanding and magical view across the Bosphorus to the European side of Istanbul. The furnishings were sleekly contemporary and everything functioned as it should. The bathroom was enormous too, and very well equipped with large separate bath and shower. There is a large terrace cafe/restaurant over the water, as well as an indoor restaurant. We had lunch at the hotel restaurant; an excellently prepared and served Italian meal. The next morning we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant. It was a multi-dish 'tasting breakfast' of traditional Turkish breakfast dishes, both sweet and savory; presented on a large wooden tray. It was outstanding. The hotel offers a free shuttle service by the hotel's launch to the European side, that runs regularly from morning to night. The hotel staff offers exceptional service; efficient, helpful, courteous. The A'jia Hotel is expensive. But the superb location, the very large and comfortable rooms, the very high quality of the restaurant and the attentive, helpful hotel staff make you feel that you get a great deal for your money. I only wish that we could have stayed longer. We will be looking forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!! Ask the right questions before booking!”
Reviews.Author: Denisefender999
Reviews.Content: Nightmare started before we arrived. After having booked and paid for everything, we received an email from the hotel owner saying ther would be a wedding on 4 of our 6 nights which kind of put us off our quiet holiday. We rang the manager and asked how late the parties would go on for and found out not only would loud music be played til midnight, they'd go on as long as guests wanted. Not only that but the whole of the hotel would be closed to us...even worse, if that's possible, we had zero access in the day too!! We chose the hotel to chill out and have a 5 star service... Beware of this hotel...we are yet to receive a full refund too as we were asked for funds on this non-refundable booking.

Reviews.Title: “Beaeeeeeeeutiful Views”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekG_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: A gem of a boutique hotel â€“ highly recommended. Right at the edge of the bosphorous with absolutely stunning views. Has a complimentary taxi service to take guests to the European side. Really pleasant staff and very well informed and eager to plan out itineraries and help guests plan out a great sightseeing filled day. Since the hotel has only 15 rooms u need to plan in advance. Definitely have a nice romantic dinner one of the days of your stay at the chic restaurant by the sea. Quite an experience !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: specialspeed
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel the first thing they did was tell us there was a "technical difficulty" and that we would not have the two rooms we had booked for our 6 night stay. To make up for the snafu they gave us lunch and dinner for the days we did not have two rooms. Since we had just arrived, we weren't sure whether this was really bad or just a minor inconvenience. We got there early, before check in time, so our rooms were not ready. They offered us breakfast, which was a nice way to spend some time. This was our first time in the restaurant and it made a really good impression. The restaurant is on the Bospherus side you have have nice view while enjoying your meal. We had the "American Breakfast" and it was very generous portions. They also serve great bread with all the meals. Even though the staff speaks english, we sometimes had communication difficulties. With the exception of one waiter, the staff would always let us know if they did not understand and we always managed to communicate what we wanted, though getting an egg white only took a couple of tries. With that one waiter we always knew there would be a problem. But in the end they always fixed every thing to our satisfaction. The food was always fresh and excellent. Food presentation was always impressive. You should keep in mind that if you are buying meals they do charge a separate cover charge of 4 TL per person, including children. The rooms are all spacious, we had three different rooms. We had a mezzanine room, a suite room and a regular room. The mezzanine rooms sounds good at first, but you have to go up and down steps. The tub in this room is also on the mezzanine level, not in the bathroom. This room faced north with some windows on the water side and some on the road side. At night traffic on the road was pretty loud in the room, so I would try to avoid the rooms that have any windows on the road side. The flat suite was very spacious with a nice sitting area and large windows that faced the water. The last room we had was one of their regular rooms on the water side. This was smaller, but not small by any means. The water views were great. They have a turn down service that includes a plate of fresh fruit or chocolates every day. This was a nice and much appreciated. One thing to keep in mind if you decide to stay here is that it is relatively far from most of the historic sites of Istanbul. It's about a 20 minute cab ride, 25TL, to the Uskudar ferry. The ferry ride, 1.75 TL, is then another 15 minutes to Eminou. There is a public bus that goes right by the hotel and stops at the ferry, but my guess is that it would take at least an hour since it makes many stops. Another nice thing the hotel has it the private boat that takes you across the Bosphorus as well as a tour of the Bosphorus. The tour goes down the east side to just north of the south bridge and then loops back. It is a nice ride with lots of things to see from the water side that you would not see from the land side. The Ajia is on the Asia side and their speed boat will take you to the European side and drop you off. They also offer pick up service. The catch is that you have to call the hotel to have them send the boat over. We didn't have a cell phone so one day we asked to be taken over and then asked that they pick us up at a specific time. They nodded and we thought they understood, but when the time came we were at the dock waiting and waiting, and not boat showed up. At that point we tried to make a call from a public phone using a credit card. Unfortunately the phone was only labeled in Turkish and we could not make any calls. We were saved by a friendly policeman who made a call for us to the hotel. A short while later the boat stopped by to pick us up. Another thing is that since this is a bit farther away from the tourist area very few folks speak english. This may or may not be an issue for you. All the people we encountered were very firendly and willing to help, if they understood you. :) Overall we were happy with our stay at the Ajia. If you go keep in mind you will need to spend some time and money getting to the historic sites. But, if you stay closer, you will definitely pay more for a smaller space and may not get the same service.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location great food and service, cant wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: martingolf
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived I was made to feel welcome and appreciated. The staff were friendly and efficient and the location overlooking the water is just perfect. The food was faultless. I wish our meeting was longer so we could have stayed an extra night.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Boutique Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: millerjo
Reviews.Content: This is the best small hotel accom we have ever stayed in. From the moment you arrive and are greeted with a welcome drink. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful.(Mr.Mete and his team was fabulous ). The rooms were immaculate and upgrading to a seaview room was worth every penny. The views are stunning!! The hotel is quietly located up the centre (which provide the magnificent views of the Bosphorus) but they have a convenient free boat shuttle service to and from the other side, if you don't want to take the long trek down the steps! Ajia Hotel is just a superb hotel where you are made to feel quite at home

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A WONDERFUL INTIMATE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: PAT606
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot everywhere and what we can say ? AJIA hotel is the BEST of the best hotel we saw in our life. romantic, charming, chic, class, with a stunning view of the impressive shores of the Bosphorous. Everything you expect you may found it there. With a service more than 5 stars!!!! Great front desk manager and people working there. We loved our stay and we be returning in the near future. Thanks a lot Mete Uskudarli and your team to make us so happy there. A VERY STRONG RECOMMENDATION

Reviews.Title: “Gay Friendly & Excellent hospitality & Personalized customer service”
Reviews.Author: gayfriend
Reviews.Content: After flying from LA, Ajia was perfect..... We spent 4 nights here and chose it based on trip advisor recommendation.Ajia Hotel met my expectations.The hotel is small but provides personal service.We were upgraded to Pasha Suite. Turkish breakfast was included. You will enjoy stunning views of the Bosphorus, fisherman boats and ships cruising up and down I stronlgy recommend this GAY FRIENDLY hotel, you will not be disappointed Now,we're in Kempinski Bodrum.....

Reviews.Title: “A true oasis in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CDubUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the A'jia just as Ramadam ended so the city was in full holiday mode. Initially we thought it was a little too far out of the way but in fact it was a true oasis of calm to return to each night where we sat watching the boats come and go from our little balcony over-looking the Bosphorous. The food was excellent and it was lovely to sit on the river-side terrace both for breakfast and dinner both nights. Great service and very quiet, restful sleep too. We will definitely go back...

Reviews.Title: “Very unprofessional, unresponsive management--overshadows beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimster_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed one evening and hotel made series of gross offenses--first mistake was not letting my friend whose name the room was booked under, check in (how could hotel of such standard make such a gross mistake?!) She had to check into another hotel as she was told room was no longer available; causing much inconvenience. Ajia further billed my card without my approval, and management was unresponsive despite multiple attempts to contact them, and messages left with desk and despite promises they would get in touch with me. I was never able to speak to a hotel manager; after over three weeks since incident occurred. Issue remains unresolved and am shocked how a hotel can have such unprofessional, uresponsive service. Management that is reportedly on holiday for a week an unable to make decisions. Hotel is indeed beautifully situated with well appointed rooms, but am shocked at extent how the management can firstly make such a gross mistake at check-in, charge my card without my consent (going against their word), and be so unresponsive (despite telling me they'd get back to me). Never had such a nightmare experience with service/billing with any hotel; appalling and needless to say frustrating. Leaves a bad taste, unfortunate as otherwise a lovely, romantic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury oasis hotel on the edge of the Bosphorous sea”
Reviews.Author: InSearchoftheBest
Reviews.Content: The Ajia Hotel is a stunning 5 star boutique hotel, balanced on top of the impressive shores of the Bosphorous. This once Ottoman Palace, boasts contemporary interiors balanced with imposing and centuries old architecture. With its breathtaking sea views and white washed walls, the Ajia promises a truly unique experience. Just a short boat ride to neighbouring villages or an approx 40 minute ferry journey into the old town, ensures you have a relaxed and peaceful stay, while still being close enough to enjoy the hustle and bustle Istanbul has to offer. The hotel's traditional, mouth watering Turkish breakfast also ensures you start the day on a full stomach. This idyllic hotel is also a prime consideration for events. We loved our stay and will be returning in the near future. Thanks again to Mete and the team for their warm hospitality and service! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and world class service.....”
Reviews.Author: helenusa
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based upon trip advisor reviews.Absolutely stunning location, directly at the Bosphorus, with huge terrace.The staff are very enthusiastic.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who looks for class. In all, this is an amazing property. If you can deal with a location that is a little out of the way for tourists, it is a wonderful place to stay I will definitely go back again and again to Ajia....

Reviews.Title: “SOOOOOOO Worth It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Secondhandgirl
Reviews.Content: Many told us we would be staying on the "wrong side of the river" by choosing Ajia Hotel. Wrong!! It is on the Asian side and about 40 mins from the heart of the action in Istanbul and that IS A VERY GOOD THING! What a wonderful, intimate hotel; exactly what we needed after a long day of sight seeing and shopping. Fabulous restaurant right on the Bosphorus that was delicious, intimate, romantic and sexy!! The staff ratio to just 15 rooms was impressive. Book it NOW!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet choice away from the center of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rompingmermaid
Reviews.Content: Very relaxing hotel on the Bosphorous. The town of Kanlica in which it is situated is famous for it's yogurt, which is well worth trying. The hotel food is exceptional; just down the road is a restaurant serving the most memorable meal we had in Turkey (Kanlica kabob). Stylishly furnished and decorted, but showing it's age.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul chic”
Reviews.Author: RMHH
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel situated on the Bosphorus with beautiful rooms facing the Bosphorus ideal for the sunset. Friendly staff, beautiful terrace, free boat to limited destinations. Our taxi driver had a bit of a problem finding it but I think he was new to the game. The downsides were that the hotel is far away from everything unlike the major brands like the Four Seasons and we had no bath in our room which was disappointing. However, great hotel and we would recommend it. If you are staying in a group great but if just a couple, the various forms of getting up the Bosphorus could be expensive and avoid road taxis, the traffic is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “elegant, comfortable but could use a little tweaking”
Reviews.Author: miaolivia
Reviews.Content: SPACE: just as pictured on site, perfect size for those who don't want to feel at all crowded, lobby furniture could use a facelift LOCATION: gorgeous view on Bosphorous; pros - quiet because in a suburb and this feels like a welcome respite after a full day in the city proper; cons - a taxi *and* ferry-ride away from all attractions on the European side of the city (the complimentary hotel shuttle boat is tiny so not recommended for the motion-sick) ACCOMMODATIONS: modern, attractive, clean and very comfortable, but recommend upper level rooms (bottom floor less quiet and private - can see staff and guests on terrace and hotel's little boat arrive/depart right outside window - especially during private events on terrace) SERVICE: good overall but not exactly 5* - thumbs up: specifically 1 of the front desk attendants exceptionally helpful and friendly; the restaurant staff was good; the concierge/manager was friendly and interested in our plans; - thumbs down: the taller attendant during our stay was not helpful or friendly; We negotiated for a particular room at booking (Waterfront Deluxe, I think), but were given a bottom floor room at check-in. We had to bring this to their attention, to which they said they were fully booked. When we showed them email documentation, they said they would have to "check". Then they said would have the WD room available the next morning due to a delay in renovations (painting the halls). The next morning we were told it would be ready the following morning and they showed us photos of the new room for approval. The following morning the new room was ready a few hours later than promised (delaying our plans) and it ended up not being the room displayed in the photos (not exactly waterfront). They didn't offer anything to offset this. Even complimentary drinks, coffee, juice, water... something on the first two days would've been a nice gesture for a 5* hotel. On the contrary, they charged us for the cappuccino and OJ we requested with breakfast (regular coffee included with the Turkish Breakfast, but OJ included with the interchangeable alternatives...), the single bottle of water we used from the mini bar, and they tried to charge us for a minibar item we didn't use.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in Istanbul: chic boutique hotel on the river”
Reviews.Author: Nevine1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful chic boutique hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise. We had spotted the property on luxury.link and in fact booked through that site for a package which included breakfast and a hotel credit. The hotel upgraded our reservation to a two level room overlooking the Bosphorus with 3 large windows. The views in this spacious airy room were outstanding and the mezzanine level with the bed very romantic. The decor was sparse, focussing on the materials and making the most of the space, views and location - it is a well executed contemporary design. Unfortunately the AC did not operate properly which made sleeping uncomfortable that first night. We reported it the next morning and were then out for the day. They attempted to fix it during our absence but it still didn't work. We were leaving the next day so didn't bother to ask them to fix it again. Also, our room did not have a separate shower but incorporated a handheld nozzle into a free standing tub. The restaurant overlooking the water is outstanding for the view and the service. The food just about keeps up with these other elements. It is worth the experience and is highly recommended. Breakfast is a gem. Be aware the hotel is on the Asia side and most sights are on the European side. The hotel's water taxi is very prompt and will ferry you in just a few minutes. It does add a bit of an adventure to any outing. The reception staff and concierge worked very hard to answer all questions although english skills are uneven. They were tremendously hospitable and helpful both before and during the stay. In summary, you'll find the hotel gracious, airy and gentile. The staff are helpful, courteous and pleasant. If you have some tolerance for a few hiccups and prefer a quiet out of the way location in noisy Istanbul, this may be just the place for you. Advice: take the car service offered by the hotel to bring you from the airport - you'll get someone with an air-conditioned vehicle who knows where the hotel is located. The fee is a bit steep at 100 euros, but we ended up paying that much in a cab which got lost and suffered from the dust coming in from the open windows!

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome & Gay Friendly.....”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter_boys
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ajia for five nights in a Bosphorus Terrace Room.Upon arrival the Manager greeted me and my partner.This was our second trip to Istanbul.We stayed at the Ciragan Kempinski two years ago.We choosed the hotel through Tripadvisor.The room was excellent,clean and clean.The Turkish breakfast is one the best breakfast I have tested.What makes this hotel different is the excellent service provided by all the staff. If you prefer a gay friendly and luxury hotel in Istanbul, I highly recommend staying at Ajia. Loved it......

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Oasis”
Reviews.Author: rebasf
Reviews.Content: Staying at Ajia was the perfect way for us to ease in to the high energy of Istanbul. Tucked away on the more residential, Asian side of this incredible city makes it a perfect oasis during your travels. The hotel is right on the Bosphorus, and our room had incredible views, was very spacious, and the bed was incredbly comfortable. The hotel offers a private water taxi to the European side, which made getting to Bebek, Nasantasu, and Ortokoy convenient. The restaurant is beautifully designed and the food met our high expectations. The hotel staff was also incredible - very accommodating and eager to help us navigate the city. I highly recommend Ajia and hope to make it back sometime soon!

Reviews.Title: “A great location to experience the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: atul_sabharwal
Reviews.Content: If there is a piece of heaven on earth it is this small boutique hotel on the banks of the Bosphorus. My wife and I stayed here in February 2010. The rooom was large spacious and clean. What makes this hotel is the location and the staff. Mete Uskudarli's team were outstanding and made us feel really welcome. Having the ship traffic in the background is a great experience andmade us feel connected to the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Of The Best”
Reviews.Author: malekabdl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotl based on other reviews.I suprised that Ajia is not top hotels on the list.We spent a fabulous 2 days here in March.This Hotel gets everything Right. A big thank you to Mr.Mete I highly recommend this hotel.I will for sure go back...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay at Hotel Ajia”
Reviews.Author: tamDubai
Reviews.Content: Magical stay at Hotel Ajia. 3 Day holiday and from beginning to end it was just perfect, I never wanted to leave. It is a stunning setting, right on the Bospherus with every bedroom window looking out at the breathtaking site. The rooms were huge, extremely comfy beds, great service, restaurant and breakfasts. There was also a lovely smart private boat belonging to the hotel that one could ask for and take every 10 minutes across to the other side. The hotel was most helpful with maps, and where to go, and where to eat etc. The local town square had a lovely jewelery market in the evenings, and the hotel was surrounded by huge stunning mansions in a quiet suburb. very easy bus access too. would recommend to anyone, I am looking to going back to take my boyfriend.

Reviews.Title: “â€œIf you are looking for a small, boutique hotel in Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: eduardoromario
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started our Turkey trip in Istanbul.I booked the hotel based upon trip advisor reviews. I booked thru Tripadvisor.The Hotel acommodated our early arrival around 07:00am.When I visit Istanbul from now on.I have been to dozens of hotels in almost 60 countries, and this is among the best! I have been to dozens of hotels in almost 30 countries, and this is among the best ! A'jia Hotel is top quality from rooms over amenities to the service attitude of the staff.(Thanks to Mete).But the most fantastic experience was the very very well-trained personnel, which is so relaxing, smiling and warm that you feel like friends with them from the very first time! I've never experienced something like this before. At the same time these guys are so professional and so good-willing when you ask for something. We really miss them now, truly! Don't book enywhere else before you check Hotel Istanbul.It's No 1!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Luxury Boutique Hotel on the banks of the Bosphorus !!!”
Reviews.Author: bob-merlin
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul in January 2010 and chose the hotel through the trip advisor.On arrival, we were greeted by Mr.Mete ,friendly and helpful Manager , provided a complimentary drink, free maps and offers of help during our three night stay I was upgraded to a room on the top floor. The room was excellent (huge, exceptionally comfortable bed) with great views of the Bosphorus.Rooms were clean and the reception staff could not have been more helpful in making our stay as comfortable and easy as possible.The hotel has been a fantastic surprise: a boutique accommodation in the hearth of the bosphorus. The manager at this location gets to know regular customers and goes out of his way to make them welcome.He knows the likes and dislikes and listens to suggestions for improvement. As you can see from all of us reviewers, this hotel is something special if you prefer a boutique hotel I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Tiego
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in this hotel. Perfect room, excellent restaurant, really nice staff... I guess we will try to come back later this year (to enjoy the amazing terrace on the Bosphorus which was closed during our stay (January) due to weather conditions).

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel by all means !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow076
Reviews.Content: I have visited Istanbul many times. It is one of my favorite cities in the world. I stayed at a different hotel each time but this is definitely the best of the best. Ajia hotel is simply stunning. From the minute I requested the booking till the minute I checked out it was an amazing experience. This trip was my partner's birthday gift and the hotel staff made every effort to accommodate our needs and make it a very pleasant experience for both of us. The room we stayed at overlooked the Bosporus. The view was breathtaking. The room is spotless clean and all amenities were in an excellent condition. The staffs were very friendly, attentive and professional. I asked if the hotel can make a gluten and dairy free cake for my partnerâ€™s birthday as a surprise and add the cost to the room charge. They made the most amazing cake and it was complementary from the hotel. A Big Thank You!!!!!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who looks for class, exclusivity and good taste. I will definitely go back again and again and again to Ajia hotel. Loay

Reviews.Title: “â€œBeautiful place on the shores of the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: aliustunkaya
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely spacious room overlooking the Bosphorus with a seating area and a desk. Bathroom had a bath and a shower. Breakfast we had in the room. This hotel was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Views of Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: ElizaDoolittleADam
Reviews.Content: Very chic boutique hotel right on the Bosphorus. The hotel even has a boat shuttle service to bring its guests to the other side on demand. Traditional Turkish Breakfast (for which they provide you the option to have in your incredible balcony without extra charge) was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Best......”
Reviews.Author: pattayathai
Reviews.Content: We checked in early and our room was ready on our arrival and to our surprise we were upgraded to a suite.The location of the hotel is amazing and our first impression of the same was much better than what we expected.Each and every staff member of the hotel were giving their best making our stay all the more enjoyable. I strongly recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking for similar kind of accommodation in Istanbul and would love to come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nufcgirl
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a fantastic boutique hotel this is. A beautiful old exterior and totally modern inside. We were upgraded to a mezzanine suite with a Bosphorous view, so had a living room and shower room downstairs, then a bed and stand alone bath upstairs - very luxurious. It's position on the Bosphorous at Kanlica was perfect, with great views from most of the rooms, and of course from the lovely terrace. The included Turkish breakfast was a revelation with lots of pots of goodies (five different cheeses, olives, honey comb, dried apricots, cherries, clotted cream, borek etc) served on a tray - very generous portions. This hotel is quite far out of town on the Asian side near the second Bosphorous bridge, which I knew as I'd lived in the city in the past. However, the journey from Ataturk airport only took about 50 minutes, even in rush hour and despite floods in the previous couple of days, because of the new motorway which bypasses the city centre. It shouldn't be too difficult to get back from town by taxi either though we didn't end up doing this. The hotel offers a boat across the Bosphorous if you want to go to the European side of the Bosphorous which was great, but most days we just took the dolmus to Uskudar for about 2.5 YTL and then got the public ferry to Eminonu for Sultan Ahmet or to Karakoy for Taksim. The area of Kanlica has a few restaurants, cafes serving yoghurt (Kanlica is famous for it's yoghurt) with honey, jam or icing sugar, and a small supermarket. The reception staff were helpful and recommended a good, upmarket fish restaurant nearby. We also went to Hidiv Kasri, an old house which serves food and drink, which was about a 15 minute walk up a very steep hill from the hotel. The service was a bit patchy when we wanted anything out of the ordinary - long waits without much communication - but overall this is definitely a hotel worth staying at, especially if you are undaunted by having to get round on your own initiative.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous alternative to the European side majors.”
Reviews.Author: dbaz54
Reviews.Content: After a dozen+ times in Istanbul, this was my first stay on the Asian side and I much appreciated the quietness and elegance of the place, as well as proximity of the Bosphorus and its fleet. If you are looking for a quiet stay at a luxury boutique hotel right by the Bosphorus, you won't find a better place. Elegant and exclusive setting, spacious rooms, extremely helpful and friendly staff (Thanks, Mete!). Commuting to the European side more than once a day might be a little taxing, but then if you need to shuttle between the city and the hotel (e.g., if you are a shopaholic) all day you stay in the city center. A'jia is out there for a different kind of traveller and get-away leisure. Recommended most enthusiastically if you can cope with leaving your hotel in the morning and coming back in the evening for a soft breezy night away from big city noise. Ah, and travelling to the Prince's Islands (again, if you are in the get-away mood) is a lot more convenient and faster from the Asian side.

Reviews.Title: “Superbness”
Reviews.Author: fatih12
Reviews.Content: Spectacular panorama, extra-ordinary location ( like on the sea ) and excellent hospitality..

Reviews.Title: “it was just wonderfull!!”
Reviews.Author: mall13
Reviews.Content: It would have been nice, if there were some relaxing chairs outside in the sun to stay during the day-I missed that.
